Home » Cars » 2017 World Car Awards – finalists list gets announced 2017 World Car Awards – finalists list gets announced / 6 comments 
We’re moving on to the next stage of the 2017 World Car Awards with the announcement of the finalists in each category of the automotive awards programme. 
This year, car manufacturers will duke it out in six categories – World Car of the Year, World Luxury Car, World Performance Car, World Green Car, World Car Design of the Year and World Urban Car – with the latter being a new addition to the awards. 
Deciding upon the winners is the duty of a 75-person jury consisting of international automotive journalists, who will evaluate each candidate before casting their vote by way of a secret ballot. 
The finalists will then be further shortlisted to just the top three in each category during the Geneva Motor Show, and all will be revealed come the New York International Auto Show in April this year. 
Last year , Mazda took home the top prize when the MX-5 was crowned the 2016 World Car of the Year, edging out the B9 Audi A4 and Mercedes-Benz GLC . The roadster also took home the World Car Design of the Year award as well. Other winners in 2016 include the Audi R8 Coupe (World Performance Car award), the G11 BMW 7 Series (World Luxury Car award), Toyota Mirai (World Green Car award).
